column4: Wikipedia says that Linux supports the SMBus. What are the tools to read out the smart battery data of my Ubuntu 7.10 computer?
smart battery data as in eta till it is charged etc?
I do not understand you. Could you say it in other words, please.
you're asking if there are tools that read out the smart data of your battery. What kind of info are you looking for? the time untill it is charged, how long the battery would last etc?
yes. And what tools are available to query the SMBus.
as far as i know those things are installed by default. do you just want that information or are you trying to develop a program of sorts?
I should like to obtain the primary information from SMBus devices on my computer's motherboard via SMBus and its associated tools.
i'm sorry, the only package i know of this, would be battery-stats. It does collect info, but it doesn't seem to be build on a program. You might find in there what you are looking for.
battery-stats is built on top of APM. APM is outdated and not enabled in my Ubuntu 7.10 computer. I will not consider it installing. A better solution is ACPI.
i wasn't talking about isntalling it. but maybe that you might find some info there that might help you find what you're looking for. :-)

I could analyze the source code of battery-stats. But I consider it outdated in view of the fact that all modern development in this area is based on ACPI. I believe that there should be tools available to query the SMBus devices on my motherboard.
i'm looking for the one that currently tracks my battery stats ...
it seems that gnome-power-manager is currently being used on my box
A high-level program that provides the information you requested is the Gnome_Power_Manager applet. Right-cklick. A context menu will appear. Click on the second menu item 'Power history'.
wasn't that what i said up far?
Well, so much better. That seems to satisfy xour needs. But I am interested in the primary (low-level) information.
AFAIK the thing you're trying to make it execute.
Your answer is too abstrect for me. Can you elaborate.
if you try to make it execute gedit, the modifier would be gedit afaik
ActionParsnip, the ubuntu logo means it's part of the main ubuntu repo's
